actions.args: {"data": {"devhub.near": {"widget": {"devhub.entity.proposal.AcceptedTerms": {"": "const { getLinkUsingCurrentGateway } = VM.require(\\\\n \\\\\\\"devhub.near/widget/core.lib.url\\\\\\\"\\\\n) || { getLinkUsingCurrentGateway: () => {} };\\\\n\\\\nState.init({\\\\n proposalBlockHeight: null,\\\\n});\\\\n\\\\nconst proposalId = props.proposalId;\\\\n\\\\nconst QUERYAPI_ENDPOINT = `https://near-queryapi.api.pagoda.co/v1/graphql`;\\\\nconst fetchGraphQL = (operationsDoc, operationName, variables) => {\\\\n return asyncFetch(QUERYAPI_ENDPOINT, {\\\\n method: \\\\\\\"POST\\\\\\\",\\\\n headers: { \\\\\\\"x-hasura-role\\\\\\\": \\\\\\\"polyprogrammist_near\\\\\\\" },\\\\n body: JSON.stringify({\\\\n query: operationsDoc,\\\\n variables: variables,\\\\n operationName: operationName,\\\\n }),\\\\n });\\\\n};\\\\n\\\\nconst queryName = \\\\\\\"polyprogrammist_near_devhub_prod_v1_proposals_with_latest_snapshot\\\\\\\";\\\\nconst query = `query GetLatestSnapshot($offset: Int = 0, $limit: Int = 10, $where: ${queryName}_bool_exp = {}) {\\\\n ${queryName}(\\\\n offset: $offset\\\\n limit: $limit\\\\n order_by: {proposal_id: desc}\\\\n where: $where\\\\n ) {\\\\n block_height\\\\n }\\\\n }`;\\\\n\\\\nconst variables = {\\\\n limit: 10,\\\\n offset,\\\\n where: { proposal_id: { _eq: proposalId } },\\\\n};\\\\n\\\\nfetchGraphQL(query, \\\\\\\"GetLatestSnapshot\\\\\\\", variables).then(async (result) => {\\\\n if (result.status === 200) {\\\\n if (result.body.data) {\\\\n const data = result.body.data?.[queryName];\\\\n State.update({ proposalBlockHeight: data[0].block_height });\\\\n }\\\\n }\\\\n});\\\\n\\\\nlet acceptedTermsVersion = Near.block().header.height;\\\\n\\\\nif (state.proposalBlockHeight !== null) {\\\\n const data = fetch(\\\\n `https://mainnet.neardata.xyz/v0/block/${state.proposalBlockHeight}`\\\\n );\\\\n if (Array.isArray(data?.body?.shards)) {\\\\n data.body.shards.map((shard) => {\\\\n const data = (shard?.chunk?.transactions ?? []).filter(\\\\n (txn) =>\\\\n txn?.transaction?.receiver_id === \\\\\\\"devhub.near\\\\\\\" &&\\\\n txn?.transaction?.actions?.[0]?.FunctionCall?.method_name ===\\\\n \\\\\\\"add_proposal\\\\\\\"\\\\n );\\\\n if (data?.length) {\\\\n const args = JSON.parse(\\\\n Buffer.from(\\\\n data[0].transaction.actions[0].FunctionCall.args,\\\\n \\\\\\\"base64\\\\\\\"\\\\n ).toString(\\\\\\\"utf8\\\\\\\")\\\\n );\\\\n acceptedTermsVersion = args.accepted_terms_and_conditions_version;\\\\n }\\\\n });\\\\n }\\\\n}\\\\n\\\\nreturn (\\\\n \\\\n DevHub\\\\u{2019}s Terms and Conditions\\\\n \\\\n);\\\\n"}}}}}

{"id": 151, "body": {"name": "DevHub Fin Ops - 07/01/24 - 07/12/24", "summary": "Oversee that proposals flow thru the payment process efficiently. Recommend new procedures to improve the proposal payment process.", "category": "DevDAO Operations", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "kyc_verified": true, "sponsor_requested_review": true, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": "theori.near", "description": "DESCRIPTION\\\\nSUMMARY\\\\nAudit and reconciliation of 2024 DevHub proposals submitted for payment processing.\\\\nDESCRIPTION\\\\nThe process to pay DevHub contributor proposals is fractured. I was brought on board to audit the current system in place, audit the records as they currently exist, propose improvements based on my findings, collaborate to implement an improved process and serve as the ongoing liason between DevHub contributors and NF as it relates to proposal payment processing.\\\\n\\\\nWeek #6 07/01/24 - 07/05/24\\\\n07/01/24 - Email, Slack, CRM updates\\\\n07/02/24 - CRM updates, TG w/Dan and Ori, Slack w/Devin\\\\n07/03/24 - Email, slack, CRM review\\\\nTotal 5.5 hours\\\\n\\\\nWeek #7 07/08/24 - 07/12/24\\\\n07/08/24 - CRM updates, TG w/Ori & Dan, Meeting w/Ori\\\\n07/09/24 - CRM updates, TG w/Ori\\\\n07/10/24 - CRM updates, email response, TG w/Dan & Ori, Write up Treasury flow\\\\n07/12/24 - Meeting w/Ori, CRM updates, email response, Slack w/Natasha\\\\nTotal 12 hours\\\\n\\\\nTotal 17.5 hours\\\\n\\\\nResults:\\\\n\\\\n2024 proposals are reconciled between DevHub portal and CRM. Proposals are flowing timely. New T&C have been implemented eliminating the need to create Ironclad contracts.  This along with eliminating the KYC/B steps during the payment process, will drastically cut down on the steps necessary and the staff necessary to process a proposal payment.  Any proposals with a number after #144 will be processed in this new way.  Any proposals with a number prior to #144 will be processed the old way, i.e. creating the Ironclad agreement.  Ori and I are now working on how or if the Treasury system is implemented.\\\\n\\\\nThere are:\\\\n5 proposals in CRM that are from the old system showing as Invoice Pending that are still in the resolution stage.\\\\n\\\\nTotal hours: 17.5\\\\nRate: $80/hour\\\\nRate determination is below the low end of the average hourly contract rate ($87 - $162) for an accountant with the same years of experience. That average rate does not account for my 5 years of blockchain specific experience. I\\\\\\'m not fulfilling all the duties that typically fall under this type of role, that is why I proposed a rate lower than the low end of the average.\\\\n\\\\nhttps://www.salary.com/research/salary/benchmark/controller-hourly-wages", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "9bd73bc9ba6ff289e2deb597dd6fe83dc0056af7a2937d6dec119660ba0146a4", "requested_sponsor": "theori.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "1400", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": []}

Any proposals with a number after #144 will be processed in this new way.  Any proposals with a number prior to #144 will be processed the old way, i.e. creating the Ironclad agreement.  Ori and I are now working on how or if the Treasury system is implemented.\\\\n\\\\nThere are:\\\\n5 proposals in CRM that are from the old system showing as Invoice Pending that are still in the resolution stage.\\\\n\\\\nTotal hours: 17.5\\\\nRate: $80/hour\\\\nRate determination is below the low end of the average hourly contract rate ($87 - $162) for an accountant with the same years of experience. That average rate does not account for my 5 years of blockchain specific experience. I\\\\\\'m not fulfilling all the duties that typically fall under this type of role, that is why I proposed a rate lower than the low end of the average.\\\\n\\\\nhttps://www.salary.com/research/salary/benchmark/controller-hourly-wages", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "9bd73bc9ba6ff289e2deb597dd6fe83dc0056af7a2937d6dec119660ba0146a4", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "1400", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": []}

I was brought on board to audit the current system in place, audit the records as they currently exist, propose improvements based on my findings, collaborate to implement an improved process and serve as the ongoing liason between DevHub contributors and NF as it relates to proposal payment processing.\\\\n\\\\nWeek #4 6/17/24 - 6/21/24\\\\n06/17/24 - Email, Slack, CRM updates, Research issues\\\\n06/18/24 - CRM updates, Zoom meeting w/Ori re:bottlenecks, TG w/Dan and Ori\\\\n06/19/24 - TG w/Dan, Research issues, Email to Ori\\\\n06/20/24 - Figma flow, Draft meeting agenda, Meeting re:T&C w/legal\\\\n06/21/24 - Meeting w/Ori re:o/s proposal issues, TG w/Dan, CRM updates, Slack w/Philipp, Review T&C and TG Ori w/comments\\\\nTotal 15.5 hours\\\\n\\\\nWeek #5 06/24/24 - 06/28/24\\\\n06/25/24 - Meeting w/Maria re:events CRM, TG w/Luca, CRM updates and research new errors, TG w/Dan\\\\n06/26/24 - CRM updates\\\\n06/27/24 - TG w/Dan and Luca, Slack w/Nargiza, CRM updates, TG w/Ori for access to Events CRM\\\\n06/28/24 - Meeting w/Ori, CRM updates\\\\nTotal 9 hours\\\\n\\\\nTotal 24.5 hours\\\\n\\\\nResults:\\\\n\\\\n2024 proposals are reconciled between DevHub portal and CRM. Ideas are flowing back and forth to improve the process further.\\\\n\\\\nThere are:\\\\n5 proposals in CRM that are from the old system showing as Invoice Pending that are still in the resolution stage\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nTotal hours: 24.5\\\\nRate: $80/hour\\\\nRate determination is below the low end of the average hourly contract rate ($87 - $162) for an accountant with the same years of experience. That average rate does not account for my 5 years of blockchain specific experience. I\\\\\\'m not fulfilling all the duties that typically fall under this type of role, that is why I proposed a rate lower than the low end of the average.\\\\n\\\\nhttps://www.salary.com/research/salary/benchmark/controller-hourly-wages", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "9bd73bc9ba6ff289e2deb597dd6fe83dc0056af7a2937d6dec119660ba0146a4", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "1960", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": []}

{"body": {"name": "Further `store` collections performance testing and enhancements.", "summary": "The goal of this proposal is to thoroughly test the \\\\\\\"unstable\\\\\\\" collections and see if those can be stabilized. In pursuit of this goal tests for other `store` collections must be introduced, showcasing basic operations on big number of elements.\\\\nAdditionally `Lazy` is going to receive a method that allows for explicit storage removal.", "category": "Tooling & Infrastructure", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": "frol.near", "description": "# Overview\\\\nThe goal of this proposal is to thoroughly test the \\\\\\\"unstable\\\\\\\" collections and see if those can be stabilized. In pursuit of this goal tests for other `store` collections must be introduced, showcasing basic operations on big number of elements. Additionally `Lazy` is going to receive a method that allows for explicit storage removal.\\\\n\\\\n# Background\\\\n`LazyOption` and `TreeMap` collections are still under unstable feature-flag. `LazyOption` lacks integration testing to determine if it indeed upholds the assumptions in terms of storage I/O. `TreeMap` used to have really poor iteration performance, which is still the case compared to other collections. Therefore it has been decided to test how this collection behaves when holding a large number of elements. \\\\nThere has also been a request for the ability to drop `Lazy` storage for easier contract migrations.\\\\n\\\\n## Relevant reading:\\\\n### TreeMap\\\\n1. https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/issues/818#issuecomment-1252681346\\\\n2. https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/pull/964\\\\n3. https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/issues/928\\\\n4. https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/issues/1199\\\\n\\\\n### LazyOption\\\\n1. https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/issues/1199\\\\n\\\\n### Lazy\\\\n1. https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/issues/1218\\\\n\\\\n# Deliverables\\\\n1. Cover applicable `store` collections with tests showcasing basic operations, while holding ~100k elements.\\\\n2. Cover `LazyOption` with integration tests showcasing assumptions about it\\\\\\'s storage usage patterns. Either confirm those assumptions or fix and move out of `unstable`.\\\\n3. Implement a `remove` method for `Lazy` values and test that.\\\\n4. Either confirm that `TreeMap` is usable via action item `1` and move it out of unstable or identify further steps for performance improvement. (NB: Bearing in mind that any kind of storage representation changes will affect some of the big modules like NFT/FT.). \\\\n\\\\n# Timeline and funding\\\\nThe estimated timeline for delivery is within the next month, with a total funding requirement of 5000 USDT, paid once the PR is raised and ready for review.", "linked_proposals": [81], "receiver_account": "22516c1b4e5d40db919e5e56a040c5670eac947fcb53a71207d5ce640a973820", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "5000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDT"}, "labels": [], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 123673371}
